definition: to flash back/flashback (in a novel, movie etc)
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation

sentences.english: The events of his boyhood are shown in a flashback.
sentences.chinese: 他童年的故事是用倒敘法來表現的。

sentences.english: Anne has a flashback about her time in the Espheni Tower.
sentences.chinese: 安妮有一個關於她在艾斯芬尼塔時間倒敘。

sentences.english: Both chronological and reverse chronological are acceptable but stick with the same throughout your CV.
sentences.chinese: 無論順敘或倒敘都可以，但記得在簡歷中保持一致。

sentences.english: Flashbacks should be used sparingly, if at all.
sentences.chinese: 即使實在要用，倒敘法也該用得節制。

sentences.english: The novel backflashes to a day in the heroine's life 20 years before.
sentences.chinese: 小說倒敘到女主人公生活中20年前的一天。

sentences.english: As for narrative scheduling, flashback and prolepse were mainly used.
sentences.chinese: 而在敘事時序上主要是利用倒敘和預敘製造懸念。

sentences.english: The film cut back to the earlier scene so that we understood her reasons.
sentences.chinese: 影片倒敘往事，這樣我們就瞭解到了她的原因。

sentences.english: At this point the writer puts in [inserts] a flashback.
sentences.chinese: 作者在這裏安插了一段倒敘。
